derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French fraternite, from Latin fraternitas, from fraternus (see fraternal)

entry.def: Fraternity refers to friendship and support between people who feel they are closely linked to each other.

example.ex: Bob needs the fraternity of others who share his mission.
example.tran: 鲍勃需要与他共同肩负这项使命的其他人的友爱互助。

entry.tran: 同业者;具有相同职业(或兴趣)的人
entry.def: You can refer to people who have the same profession or the same interests as a particular fraternity .

example.ex: ...the spread of stolen guns among the criminal fraternity.
example.tran: 盗窃枪支流入犯罪团伙手中

entry.tran: (美国男大学生)联谊会，兄弟会
entry.def: In the United States, a fraternity is a society of male university or college students.

means.word_mean: 1. a social club for male undergraduates
2. people engaged in a particular occupation;
